title: owenle
author: owenle
content: What one factor can cause the current bull run to stop ? Like US making some law against bitcoin.

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: Bitcoin being banned in the US could do it but I don't think the US government is there yet (maybe in near future if dollar is dumped more in the ongoing dedollarisation process).The only threat in my opinion is going to be recession.Just like before, each time there is a recession that affects a large number of countries (eg. COVID pandemic recession) we always see bitcoin bull market stop and even change into a bear market.With the way global tensions and armed conflicts are expanding, the chances of it are rising. For example after a decade the terrorist organization branched out of ISIL established their "khalifah" once again inside Syria this morning and that threat could very quickly expand and destabilize the entire Arab region which will affect the energy market which will then affect the global economy and cause recession.But for the time being and until such things happen, the global economy is becoming compatible with the current level of recession and unless things change, the recession's effects is not going to change either. Which means bitcoin will remain in bull market.

comments.author: WatChe
comments.body: Quote from: pooya87 on December 08, 2024, 05:38:52 AMBitcoin being banned in the US could do it but I don't think the US government is there yet (maybe in near future if dollar is dumped more in the ongoing dedollarisation process).The only threat in my opinion is going to be recession.Just like before, each time there is a recession that affects a large number of countries (eg. COVID pandemic recession) we always see bitcoin bull market stop and even change into a bear market.With the way global tensions and armed conflicts are expanding, the chances of it are rising. For example after a decade the terrorist organization branched out of ISIL established their "khalifah" once again inside Syria this morning and that threat could very quickly expand and destabilize the entire Arab region which will affect the energy market which will then affect the global economy and cause recession.But for the time being and until such things happen, the global economy is becoming compatible with the current level of recession and unless things change, the recession's effects is not going to change either. Which means bitcoin will remain in bull market.Global conflicts are on the rise, first we have Russia Ukraine conflict followed by Israel invasion in Gaza and lately we have regime change in Syria. It's interesting that in Syria within few days the opposition have taken control over the whole country. With so many conflicts going on, the global economy will defiantly suffer and many will find Bitcoin as safe heaven for there capital because of degrading value of fiat. Unless these conflicts cease to exist and global economy finds stability, the Bitcoin will rule.

comments.author: legiteum
comments.body: Quote from: owenle on December 08, 2024, 04:08:42 AMWhat one factor can cause the current bull run to stop ? Like US making some law against bitcoin. Another FTX would do it, especially if Trump pardons the next SBF because he bought some of his coin. This will scare investors away from the crypto market for another 10 years.A US recession would also do it: all of those crypto bros needing to cash in their bags to pay their bills after they lost their jobs? That would cause a crypto death spiral.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: owenle on December 08, 2024, 04:08:42 AMWhat one factor can cause the current bull run to stop ? Like US making some law against bitcoin. I think the sentimental cycle that people have for bitcoin is also one for the reasons the bull market will stop but later continue after bear market. If we should predict the time, that would be in 2026. But with the way bitcoin is right now, I do not know if that will happen or not, but I think bitcoin holders and traders know about this and they may prefer to sell some of their coins and going for short position respectively at the time.

comments.author: HeRetiK
comments.body: Apart from global tensions crashing the markets (including Bitcoin) there's also a fair chance that the Bitcoin price will simply overextend itself followed by a large crash into a new crypto winter until the next cycle begins.Question being whether the current bull run will manage to top off to completion (see 2013, 2017) or will be cut short by another global crisis (2021, presumably).

comments.author: arwin100
comments.body: Quote from: owenle on December 08, 2024, 04:08:42 AMWhat one factor can cause the current bull run to stop ? Like US making some law against bitcoin. Big issues which can bother or manipulate the minds of people. Right now the possible FUDs that can trigger that to happen is Mt.Gox massive sell off FUDs, America stop their support on bitcon then throw out bad statement that can affect those investors so bad. Then last thing is global financial crisis since maybe bitcoin might get affected with that.Although those things are just speculation for now but we could see in future on what issue will come out that would able to stop bitcoin bull run condition. But also I guess this should be the less thing people should think about since what's more important at current condition is on how people could take advantage on current growth earned by bitcoin.

comments.author: AbuBhakar
comments.body: Quote from: owenle on December 08, 2024, 04:08:42 AMWhat one factor can cause the current bull run to stop ? Like US making some law against bitcoin. If whale investor like Michael Saylor decided to take profit or Blackrock out on offering Bitcoin ETF investment due to legal issue or different kind of FUD.These institutional investors can be a giant ticking bomb that can create a huge panic in Bitcoin market since they are the one who pump this market too on the current price. Only FUD can make the Bitcoin price collapse since everything on Bitcoin technology end is decentralized so no shitty founder will be able to destroy the project on its own unlike shitcoins that has an active founder that has full control in smart contracts.

comments.author: tbct_mt2
comments.body: Quote from: legiteum on December 08, 2024, 06:08:38 AMAnother FTX would do it, especially if Trump pardons the next SBF because he bought some of his coin. This will scare investors away from the crypto market for another 10 years.Bitcoin market has never stopped spinning and it won't. After some big exchange hacks, collapses like Mt.Gox, FTX, Bitcoin market has been continuing its operation and its growth is rapidly parabolic.If a collapse, bankruptcy of a single centralized exchange can destroy Bitcoin market, it isn't a strong market and no longer attractive for investors.[LIST] Hacked exchanges since 2011.Report on cryptocurrency exchange hacks.QuoteA US recession would also do it: all of those crypto bros needing to cash in their bags to pay their bills after they lost their jobs? That would cause a crypto death spiral.Does it sound true if you know of reasons for Bitcoin Genesis Block in January 2009?https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Genesis_blockIt's a day of "The Times 03/Jan/2009 Chancellor on brink of second bailout for banks"

comments.author: Luzin
comments.body: Quote from: owenle on December 08, 2024, 04:08:42 AMWhat one factor can cause the current bull run to stop ? Like US making some law against bitcoin. During my experience learning about Bitcoin, bad news and market saturation are the main factors where the market will go. So far, we have seen, in this cycle period there is a lot of good news that continues to encourage speculation and prices to rise. So I don't see any bad news that caused Bitcoin to crash. It's just that I see some reasonable saturation for the market but market confidence is pushing back the price of Bitcoin to continue to rise. This condition is like a cycle, there is bad news that lowers market confidence and good news that makes the market excited.Â  IMO

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: Quote from: HeRetiK on December 08, 2024, 10:04:05 AMa fair chance that the Bitcoin price will simply overextend itself followed by a large crash into a new crypto winter until the next cycle begins.To be fair this scenario which is common in each cycle first requires a bubble to form. In other words price has to go way higher than this in a much shorter period for it to be considered a bubble. For example back in 2017 price went from below $1000 to $20000 and mot importantly it went from $10k to $20k in less than a month which created a bubble which then led to the long bear market.Right now we are just getting out of "slum" and starting the bull run. Price has to reach something like $1 million to be a bubble and pop and lead to bear market

comments.author: Wakate
comments.body: Quote from: owenle on December 08, 2024, 04:08:42 AMWhat one factor can cause the current bull run to stop ? Like US making some law against bitcoin. Fundamental analysis is very important as a crypto investor or trader and many experience investors have utilize this in know what could happen in the market in the next couples of hours. It is good we understand the news aspect of cryptocurrency so that we are not going to be taking decisions blindly when we ought to be making lots of money as crypto enthusiastic. There are some kind of news that could make the price of Bitcoin to drop which is going to have huge effects on the general crypto market. People would be panicked to sell when they hear of war news or strict regulations on some kind of cryptocurrency assets.

comments.author: mirakal
comments.body: Quote from: owenle on December 08, 2024, 04:08:42 AMWhat one factor can cause the current bull run to stop ? Like US making some law against bitcoin. Indeed, the US and the statements from Trump play a big role in driving up the price of bitcoin. However, they could also easily cause it to drop if their approach has a negative impact. Like if they pass laws that are against the will of the majority and negatively impact the crypto market, it would likely drag prices down as investors rush to sell.But even if the US continues to support crypto, that does not mean that the price of bitcoin will never fall anymore. I believe in the natural market cycleâafter every bull season, a bearish season will come next. In fact, we have been experiencing this already.

comments.author: m2017
comments.body: Quote from: owenle on December 08, 2024, 04:08:42 AMWhat one factor can cause the current bull run to stop ? Like US making some law against bitcoin. The start of any major sale of bitcoin, causing a drop in price by 10-20%, will certainly cause a stop in the bull run. The reasons may be anything and it is not fundamentally important.I have suspicions that the bull run has not really started yet, since the bitcoin's price at one moment has suddenly jerked, and then continues to hang around at the same level. Have the bulls made a false start?

comments.author: Marvell1
comments.body: Quote from: owenle on December 08, 2024, 04:08:42 AMWhat one factor can cause the current bull run to stop ? Like US making some law against bitcoin. The market is cyclical, there is always positive news that is spread to trigger a bull market and there is always negative news that impacts the market causing a bear market. If you look at the history of previous cycles, you will see only one scenario being used over and over again. Like bitcoin, we can't predict, we will never know what news will make the bull market stop and turn into a bear market. But we know for sure that at some point, the bear season will come so let's always keep an eye on the market, take profits at the right time and don't let the bears take away all our profits.

comments.author: Btcdeybodi
comments.body: Quote from: owenle on December 08, 2024, 04:08:42 AMWhat one factor can cause the current bull run to stop ? Like US making some law against bitcoin. You asked a question though but honestly for now, there is no atmosphere of anything that will stop the current bull run except in the future if one of the largest exchanges crashes or institutional investors begins a massive selling of their bitcoins if not the only thing that can happen will be for the price to DIP and bounce back after sometimes because a lot of investors now have faith in bitcoin more than any other digital currency and since there is a global rising interest in bitcoin now, anything that will lead to a decline in the current bull trend may as well affect the global economy. Even if US makes laws that will go against bitcoin, the price will only DIP and experience growth again in the future. Inasmuch as there are some regulatory framework by the United States SEC and other regulatory body, i don't think the United Sates of America will want to makes laws against bitcoin, besides they still hold the highest bitcoins among countries in the world so it's not as if any other country has more bitcoins than them. However, bitcoin is still valued in the dollars which has been the currency of the US so everything about bitcoin is still to their own advantage.

comments.author: legiteum
comments.body: Quote from: tbct_mt2 on December 08, 2024, 11:36:07 AMQuote from: legiteum on December 08, 2024, 06:08:38 AMAnother FTX would do it, especially if Trump pardons the next SBF because he bought some of his coin. This will scare investors away from the crypto market for another 10 years.Bitcoin market has never stopped spinning and it won't. After some big exchange hacks, collapses like Mt.Gox, FTX, Bitcoin market has been continuing its operation and its growth is rapidly parabolic.Nobody here is talking about Bitcoin "stopping". If BTC retreated to $1000 right now, it wouldn't be "stopped". FTX caused a dip in Bitcoin that lasted quite a while, and I would argue that there would be a "fool me twice" sort of effect if there was another major failure like that. Bitcoin has absolutely no intrinsic value, so it will always necessarily be very volatile in its price--and thus very sensitive to bad market news (in South Korea last week it briefly fell to $40k when they had political unrest for instance).Today, Bitcoin's price is propped up by a much broader group of investors, many of whom are smaller consumer investors who are much more skittish. QuoteIf a collapse, bankruptcy of a single centralized exchange can destroy Bitcoin market, it isn't a strong market and no longer attractive for investors.Again, nobody here is talking about "destroying" anything, but certainly a major market scare could drag BTC down by 90% and keep it that way for five years or more. That will "destroy" a lot of people's retirement savings, but Bitcoin itself as a technical platform will be totally fine.QuoteQuoteA US recession would also do it: all of those crypto bros needing to cash in their bags to pay their bills after they lost their jobs? That would cause a crypto death spiral.Does it sound true if you know of reasons for Bitcoin Genesis Block in January 2009?Oh come on, Bitcoin is 5000 lightyears from it's origins today. People buy Bitcoin for one reason, which is to sell it later for more. It is a speculation instrument. I get that if you are an "OG bitcoiner", you have no use for all of these n00bs that don't know the philosophy behind Bitcoin, but guess what: if these n00bs leave, then then Bitcoin loses 90% of its market value because their money leaves too.

comments.author: CoinFoxs
comments.body: Bitcoin almost reached its all-time-high price just because there are investors from a big market started investing in Bitcoins when demand increases in the market the price automatically starts increasing so investors get the peak point now they start selling Bitcoin to get a profit which they told to get by investing in bitcoin. After that massive selling, the bitcoin drops and will probably be trading between 68k$ 74k$ by the end of December.

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: Quote from: legiteum on December 08, 2024, 05:41:34 PMNobody here is talking about Bitcoin "stopping". If BTC retreated to $1000 right now, it wouldn't be "stopped". That actually might stop bitcoin, specially if such a catastrophic crash to such a low price becomes prolonged. Bitcoin's mining industry has grown and it has grown based on its price. When price has been above $60k for a long time, the hashrate grows based on that profit.If it crashes, the profit crashes therefore miners stop.Miners stopping means hashrate drops significantly and that puts bitcoin in danger of 51% attacks.Quote(in South Korea last week it briefly fell to $40k when they had political unrest for instance).On which exchange because I am curious to see why the traders missed such a massive opportunity for making a massive profit using arbitrage. That would have beeen roughly 250000% profit!

comments.author: boyptc
comments.body: Quote from: owenle on December 08, 2024, 04:08:42 AMWhat one factor can cause the current bull run to stop ? Like US making some law against bitcoin. Trump talking nonsense about Bitcoin.Elon talking the same. But I think if ever there are some words spit by them that go against Bitcoin, it's going to temporarily stop the bull run. And for this bull run to be stopped, I guess another major exchange getting some bad news will totally have a major impact on it.
